content.html:
I’m a graduate student at Northeastern University’s ALIGN program pursuing a master’s degree in Computer Science. The ALIGN program consists of a series of bridge courses for graduate students who didn’t major in Computer Science in their undergraduate studies. Upon completion of the ALIGN program, students begin taking graduate-level classes in computer science.

My interest in attaining a master’s degree in computer science is to link my community experience with technology and leverage this knowledge to contribute to the self-development and self-sufficiency of communities of color, as well as to enhance people’s capacities to solve problems. My long-term goal is to create a workers cooperative of social justice focused technologists, “Technology for Communities,” which specializes in civic technology to assist community organizations by assessing needs, analyzing data and creating solutions. A computer science degree combined with my collective experience as a community organizer will allow me to use technology collaboratively with organizations and individuals to address needs to strengthen communities and amplify our collective voice.
